page.title: 08HOGNASTON VILLAGE HALL
page.content: Hognaston village hall is a replacement for the old timber and corrugated iron building. It looks like a large bungalow.It is built of stone and has a slate roof. The doors and window frames are made of wood. The building was only completed in 1982.The money, Â£28,000, needed to build the hall was raised by the village people.They ran coffee evenings,and for 5 years held a special village market. The hall itself was designed by an architect who lived in the village.The stone used in the building was donated by the Severn Trent Water Board who were constructing Carsington Resevoir,the stone coming from an old farm building.
